phrase.text: Wie weit ist es bis zum Bahnhof?
phrase.i18nText: How far is the train station?

phrase.text: Gehen Sie an der Kreuzung rechts.
Entschuldigung, können Sie mir sagen wie ich zur Post komme?
phrase.i18nText: Excuse me, could you tell me how to get to the post office?

phrase.text: Können Sie ein Photo von mir machen?

phrase.text: Die nächste Bushaltestelle ist am Ende der Straße.
phrase.i18nText: The next bus stop is at the end of the street.

phrase.text: Wir treffen uns um 18 Uhr in der Innenstadt.
phrase.i18nText: We are going to meet at 6 o'clock in the town square.

phrase.text: Lass uns in die Innenstadt gehen.
phrase.i18nText: Let's go to the city centre.

phrase.text: Der Zoo ist in der Nähe der Polizeiwache.
phrase.i18nText: The zoo is next to the police station.

phrase.text: Können wir zu Fuß dorthin gehen?

phrase.text: Was würden Sie empfehlen, wo wir zuerst hingehen gehen sollten?
phrase.i18nText: What would you recommend to see in the first place?
How much is the admission fee?
Do you have any free maps of the city?
Would you like to visit National Gallery?

phrase.text: Unsere heutige Endstation ist eine lokale Brauerei.
phrase.i18nText: Our final destination today will be a local distillery.

phrase.text: Sie müssen unbedingt die alte Burg besichtigen.
phrase.i18nText: You must visit the old castle.

phrase.text: Nehmen Sie die zweite Ausfahrt am Kreisverkehr. Folgen Sie der Straße für einen Kilometer. Das Museum befindet sich dann auf der rechten Seite.
phrase.i18nText: Take the second exit at the roundabout. Continue straight ahead for about a mile. The museum will be on your right.

phrase.text: London is a capital of England. It is a diverse and exciting city with many attractions. The most visited tourist attractions are London Eye, the National Gallery and Tower of London. Also Buckingham Palace situated is in the city centre is a popular sight as it is the official residence of the British Queen. Every day in front of the palace Changing the Guard ceremony takes place. This is worth seeing while you are visiting London and it is usually witnessed by large crowds.
phrase.i18nText: London is a capital of England. It is a diverse and exciting city with many attractions. The most visited tourist attractions are London Eye, the National Gallery and Tower of London. Also Buckingham Palace situated is in the city centre is a popular sight as it is the official residence of the British Queen. Every day in front of the palace Changing the Guard ceremony takes place. This is worth seeing while you are visiting London and it is usually witnessed by large crowds.

phrase.text: Welcome to Rome! Why don't you join us for a “hop on, hop off” sightseeing tour of the city... The buses leave every 15 minutes from the train station and stop at 10 different city attractions. You can get off the bus at any stop and enjoy your time in the local area for as long as you want. For more information come and ask tourist information office just next to the main train station entrance.
phrase.i18nText: Welcome to Rome! Why don't you join us for a “hop on, hop off” sightseeing tour of the city... The buses leave every 15 minutes from the train station and stop at 10 different city attractions. You can get off the bus at any stop and enjoy your time in the local area for as long as you want. For more information come and ask tourist information office just next to the main train station entrance.

phrase.text: The gallery is open Monday-Friday from 10 am until 5 pm. Entrance fee is 10$ for adults and 5$ for children under 12 years of age. Photographing is strictly prohibited in the whole building and all cameras must be left in the cloakroom.
